neighbors.name: Guy B. Tiner
neighbors.claims: Guy B. Tiner is a longtime resident of Bonner Springs and a veteran local developer [Bonner Springs City Council](https://www.bonnersprings.org/Archive.aspx?ADID=230). He operates **Tiner Construction** and has been involved in residential developments such as "The Villages at Deerfield" and "Lei Valley" [Bonner Springs Planning Commission](https://www.bonnersprings.org/Archive.aspx?ADID=414). He is the registered agent for **LER Properties II LLC**, which holds land interests in the county [Wyandotte Echo](https://wyandotteecho.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/Echo100721A.pdf). In public hearings, he has self-identified as a "baby boomer" and noted his service on a regional committee guiding Kansas City's World Cup hosting activities [Wyandotte County UGTV](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Uq185bchZSs).
neighbors.influence_justification: Active developer; served on regional World Cup committee

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage regarding his development experience and regional committee work. Acknowledge his role in local housing projects like Lei Valley to build professional rapport.

citations.claim: Identified as resident and developer of "The Villages at Deerfield"
citations.title: Bonner Springs Planning Commission Minutes Jan 2012

citations.claim: Operates Tiner Construction and developed Lei Valley
citations.title: Bonner Springs Planning Commission Minutes Dec 2013

citations.claim: Registered agent for LER Properties II LLC
citations.title: The Wyandotte Echo Legal Notices

citations.claim: Serves on regional World Cup committee and identifies as baby boomer
citations.title: Unified Government Commission Meeting

neighbors.name: Martha E. Gonzalez
neighbors.claims: In January 2021, Martha E. Gonzalez (residing at 1032 S. 25th St) applied to acquire a Unified Government Land Bank lot to construct a building for storing and maintaining trucks [Wyandotte Daily](https://wyandotteonline.com/tag/unified-government-commission/page/5/). This application suggests involvement in a logistics or vehicle maintenance enterprise [Wyandotte Daily](https://wyandotteonline.com/tag/unified-government-commission/page/5/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local small business applicant; no public office found

approach_recommendations.engage: Focus on site utility and drainage, as her interest in vehicle maintenance facilities suggests a practical concern for site accessibility and stormwater management.

citations.claim: Applied for Land Bank lot to store and maintain trucks
citations.title: Wyandotte Daily News - UG Commission Agenda

neighbors.verification_notes: Removed Richard S. Crystal from profile. No recent records link him to this address or Martha E. Gonzalez in Wyandotte County. Historical records show a Richard S. Crystal in the 19th century or different states, suggesting a data error in the draft. Confirmed Martha Gonzalez's truck facility application.

neighbors.name: Daniel J. Poolman & Karen A. Poolman (Deceased)
neighbors.claims: Daniel J. Poolman and Karen A. Poolman were married in 1966 and raised three children in the community [Dignity Memorial](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/kansas-city-ks/karen-poolman-9194736). Karen Ann Poolman passed away in May 2020 at the age of 72, leaving Daniel as the surviving spouse [Dignity Memorial](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/kansas-city-ks/karen-poolman-9194736).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime residents; no public leadership roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a neighborly, respectful approach honoring their decades of residence. Be mindful of the household's status as a widower's residence.

citations.claim: Married 1966, Karen passed 2020, Daniel surviving spouse
citations.title: Obituary for Karen Ann Poolman

neighbors.verification_notes: Redacted children's names for privacy per Phase 3 instructions. Confirmed death and marriage details via obituary.
